column5: hey guys just wondering if anyone knows if  steelhead wll eat live leeches and  how should I fish them? thanks
Steelhead will eat anything.  Fish them under a float just like you would a worm.
ok thanks and in fall of spring?
Yup, really shouldn't matter.  They'll eat them.

I guess if you had a big supply of leaches and nothing else to do with them, then why not.  But for convenience and cheap availability, nothing beats worms!  The added bonus is that they work like a hot damn!
Worms are a lot cheaper as well   But for action under the water, leeches are great.
Steelhead will eat anything.  Fish them under a float just like you would a worm. To clarify here's a steelhead taken on a 8" rouser(jerkbait) while musky fishing
